title: web.get Request Application Programming Interface (API) Schema
description: Performs a simple HTTP or HTTPS GET request against an external endpoint, and returns the response to the Notecard.

route.description: Alias for a Proxy Route in Notehub.

name.description: A web URL endpoint relative to the host configured in the Proxy Route. URL parameters may be added to this argument as well (e.g. `/getLatest?id=1`).

content.description: The MIME type of the body or payload of the response. Default is `application/json`.

seconds.description: If specified, overrides the default 90 second timeout.

async.description: If `true`, the Notecard performs the web request asynchronously, and returns control to the host without waiting for a response from Notehub.

binary.description: If `true`, the Notecard will return the response stored in its binary buffer.

offset.description: Used along with `binary:true` and `max`, sent as a URL parameter to the remote endpoint. Represents the number of bytes to offset the binary payload from 0 when retrieving binary data from the remote endpoint.

max.description: Used along with `binary:true` and `offset`, sent as a URL parameter to the remote endpoint. Represents the number of bytes to retrieve from the binary payload segment.

file.description: The name of the local-only Database Notefile (`.dbx`) to be used if the web request is issued asynchronously and you wish to store the response.

note.description: The unique Note ID for the local-only Database Notefile (`.dbx`). Only used with asynchronous web requests (see `file` argument above).

samples.description: Performs a simple HTTP or HTTPS GET request and returns the response.

info: Learn more in this guide on [Sending and Receiving Large Binary Objects](guides-and-tutorials/notecard-guides/sending-and-receiving-large-binary-objects).
warning: The Notecard must have an active connection to Notehub while performing any web.* request. Please [consult this guide](https://dev.blues.io/notecard/notecard-walkthrough/web-transactions/) for more information.
